channel.title: moocs on C'est la Z
channel.description: Recent content in moocs on C'est la Z

item.title: Stanford classes -- what I'd do next
item.description: <!DOCTYPE html> Now that the ML and AI courses are at an end, here are some of the things I would do moving forward. Both courses already have a basic track where students just watch the lectures and do the in lecture quizzes and an advanced track where students also complete weekly assignments. I think we can be certain that there were students who just watched a few lectures, many who completed every assignment, and those who fell at all points in between.

item.title: ML and AI Courses - how they were taught
item.description: <!DOCTYPE html> This is the first in a three part series. Part 1 talks about my take on how the courses were presented. in Part 2, I'll discuss my take on how to improve the experience and finally, in part 3, we'll look at on line education with an emphasis on the high school market. As some of you know, I've been taking the on line Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence courses offered by Stanford this semester.
